elements.label: Corrivality: Stalemate
elements.description: As of now, neither the Exile nor their Foe can claim the upper hand over the other. Nothing significant will occur, yet.

elements.label: Corrivality: Exile's Advantage
elements.description: My friend is giving their Foe a thrashing.

elements.label: Corrivality: Foe's Advantage
elements.description: The Foe has my friend on the run, again.

elements.label: Nothing
elements.description: Unremarkable and uneventful.

elements.label: Silent Days
elements.description: So much of war is waiting.

elements.label: Transcendent Days
elements.description: These are the nights that are ripe for dreaming.

elements.label: Inclement Days
elements.description: The heavens send down their troubles.

elements.label: Welcome Days
elements.description: Food for the hungry, relief for the weary.

elements.label: Bleak Days
elements.description: A conclusion?

elements.label: Fierce Days
elements.description: And the fires shall climb higher.

elements.label: Provisions
elements.description: Bullets, bandages, brittle tins of meat.

elements.label: Resolution
elements.description: I have seen matters to their end. [A measure of your repute and capability as a participant in the Corrivality. If you live to hang up your arms, this card will influence how your life proceeds thereafter.]

elements.label: Progress
elements.description: Towards an end.

elements.label: Strife
elements.description: When we fight, we fuel the Corrivality and help drive its titanic convolutions. In turn, the Corrivality inflames and excites the warring world around us. The one called Exile described the phenomenon as 'beautiful.' [As Strife increases, your Enemies will become more aggressive and more numerous. A terrifying force may be drawn to your location once Strife reaches seven.]

elements.label: Trauma
elements.description: The spirit can only endure so much. [A total of five Traumas will break you.]

elements.label: Memory: Regret
elements.description: There are always choices, and so there are always regrets.

elements.label: Memory: Joy
elements.description: There was a better time, once. I am sure of it.

elements.label: Memory: Rage
elements.description: Anger - anger is a weapon.

elements.label: Memory: Fear
elements.description: In the shadows of the soul are the things we wish we could forget.

elements.label: Memory: Calm
elements.description: And so at the eye of the tempest: peace.

elements.label: Memory: Grief
elements.description: Pain and sorrow.

elements.label: Memory: Ingenuity
elements.description: The first beginnings of a good plan.

elements.label: Memory: Taste
elements.description: Dwelling on those thoughts which induce desire.

elements.label: Memory: Unexpected
elements.description: Sometimes there is no logic to follow. Sometimes the dots don't have to connect.

elements.label: Memory: Revelation
elements.description: I SEE.

elements.label: Cunning
elements.description: 'All warfare is based on deception.' - Sun Tzu, The Art of War

elements.label: Wisdom
elements.description: A soldier must know how best to manoeuvre the pieces on the board - and also how best to sacrifice them.

elements.label: Patience
elements.description: That which surpasses strength.

elements.label: A Wounded Face
elements.description: I should have this looked at immediately. [A total of five Wounds and Debilitations will kill you.]

elements.label: A Pierced Hand
elements.description: I should have this looked at immediately. [A total of five Wounds and Debilitations will kill you.]

elements.label: A Shattered Knee
elements.description: I should have this looked at immediately. [A total of five Wounds and Debilitations will kill you.]

elements.label: A Ripped Ear
elements.description: I should have this looked at immediately. [A total of five Wounds and Debilitations will kill you.]

elements.label: A Missing Eye
elements.description: Half the world is as night. [A total of five Wounds and Debilitations will kill you.]

elements.label: An Amputated Hand
elements.description: I suppose I can only use small arms, now. [A total of five Wounds and Debilitations will kill you.]

elements.label: An Amputated Leg
elements.description: If I were a horse, they would just have shot me. [A total of five Wounds and Debilitations will kill you.]

elements.label: A Deafened Ear
elements.description: Gunfire, or rainfall? Sometimes I cannot tell. [A total of five Wounds and Debilitations will kill you.]

elements.label: Field Hospital
elements.description: A well-equipped medical facility is a welcome blessing to any soldier. Unfortunate, then, that all we have is this place. [Wounded Allies can be healed here.]

elements.label: Field Hospital (Exhausted)
elements.description: A well-equipped medical facility is a welcome blessing to any soldier. Unfortunate, then, that all we have is this place. [Wounded Allies can be healed here.]

elements.label: Field Hospital (Destroyed)
elements.description: No place for the wounded, now. [You can restore this card with Engineers and Provisions.]

elements.label: Communications Post
elements.description: Words on wires. Pick up the receiver - someone is listening. [While this card is on the board, you will be able to quickly request reinforcements.]

elements.label: Communications Post (Destroyed)
elements.description: Who will hear us now? [You can restore this card with Engineers and Provisions.]

elements.label: Barracks
elements.description: A roof to keep out the rain, and walls to keep out the rest. Our comrades will be able to lodge here comfortably enough.

elements.label: Barracks (Destroyed)
elements.description: Not really that suitable for sleeping, anymore. [You can restore this card with Engineers and Provisions.]

elements.label: Requisitioned Farm
elements.description: Old hay and coarse earth. At least we aren't sleeping outside.

elements.label: Requisitioned Church
elements.description: God is watching.

elements.label: The Madrugad's Shadow
elements.description: Here is that unerring cold that waits in the hours that precede the sun; here the Madrugad makes her tally.

elements.label: The Velvet's Shadow
elements.description: The coiling of the roots, the safety of the shadows, the rumbling in the mists - these mark the presence of the Velvet.

elements.label: The Beachcomber's Shadow
elements.description: Shrapnel gleams like silver, and bone beckons like finest porcelain. That greedy, seeking Hour called Beachcomber has come to roost.

elements.label: The Colonel's Shadow
elements.description: Sights and sounds grow duller, and colours leak from the world. The cold on my neck feels like the press of a knife. The Colonel watches from on high.

elements.label: The Lionsmith's Shadow
elements.description: A boastful heat rises in the cold; fires hiss and laugh. Thoughts that do not stoke anger become difficult to hold onto. The Lionsmith is here in attendance.

elements.label: The Wolf-Divided's Shadow
elements.description: That scent which is neither tar nor blood nor ozone. The Wolf-Divided's rage boils beneath the air.

elements.label: Wolves
elements.description:
'Whoever feeds the wolf in the winter will be eaten by him in the spring.'

- Greek Proverb

elements.label: A Dove
elements.description: A bird of peace - perhaps it is lost.

elements.label: Cats
elements.description: Amiable little killers.

elements.label: Ruins
elements.description: Crumbling edifices and old masonry provide what protection they can.

elements.label: Sewers
elements.description: Where the shadows survive, so can we.

elements.label: Heights
elements.description: To strike from up on high.

elements.label: Flames
elements.description: Fire is the winter that warms and the spring that consumes.

elements.label: Snows
elements.description: We have learnt winter's measure, and will be at home in it.

elements.label: Storms
elements.description: The rain on our backs is a rejuvenation. Baptism.

elements.label: Fog
elements.description: Mists are a gift from the Velvet, so long as one can figure how to appreciate them.

elements.label: Dawn
elements.description: Sunrise, when the world is clean.

elements.label: Noon
elements.description: From here, the sun can only decline.

elements.label: Sunset
elements.description: Sunset, when the light is richer.

elements.label: Night
elements.description: Under darkness.

elements.label: Opportunity: A Church
elements.description: A place of faith, but not of power. I could quarter some of my men here if I needed to, or perhaps the quiet space might lead me to a useful realization.

elements.label: Opportunity: A Farm
elements.description: We could convince the farmers to furnish us with food and drink - men with guns are famously convincing, after all - or perhaps we would rather use their land for lodgings.

elements.label: Armour-Piercing Munitions
elements.description: Perhaps one day there will be armour that cannot be penetrated by any weapon. But we have yet to reach that day.

elements.label: Explosives
elements.description: Force and fire, sealed up in clever machinery and eager to be unbound.

elements.label: Flare Shells
elements.description: A little light for the long dark. [This can be used to reveal Hidden Enemies.]

elements.label: Secret-Scarred Stone
elements.description: Don't look, don't tell, don't know. Much heavier than it looks.

elements.label: Solar Fragment
elements.description: A token by which one may recall Glory.

elements.label: Shahpur's Nails
elements.description: Each one is solid taenite-iron and runs as long as an arm, more akin to a railroad spike than any sort of nail. I would need a sledgehammer to drive this into anything.

elements.label: Mycological Sample T-13
elements.description: Digitium regius. I encountered this strain of fungus on one of my last cases with the OPRP. The fact they have not yet incinerated this sample peturbs me, but with a war on, even the most unseemly things can be useful as weapons.

elements.label: Kusnetsov's Eye
elements.description: In his twilight years, Prince Kusnetsov became convinced of the notion that he had been cursed, and went bizarre lengths to purify himself. He procured this pearl in the Dry Country, intending to pulverize and consume it, but later found himself unable to do so - the pearl, Prince Kusnetsov claimed, would 'speak in two voices' against any decision he made to blemish it.

elements.label: Dulcet Violin
elements.description: An exquisite violin shaped from Tyrolean maple, commissioned from the esteemed tradition of Peregaldi luthiers in the 19th century. It almost feels wrong for me to be handling such a delicate, beautiful instrument - and I don't know how to play it, either.

elements.label: Apocryphal Key
elements.description: St. Peter was given two keys: one gold that would give him power to open and bind the gates of Heaven, and one silver that would permit him authority over any door on Earth. This key is not either of them, but those doors that are neither in Heaven nor on Earth will listen to it.
